contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album<!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Very Proud of Ya | Type = Album | Artist = [[AFI (band)|AFI]] | Cover = AFI - Very Proud of Ya cover.jpg | Released = June 18, 1996 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Hardcore punk]] | Length = 39:43 | Label = [[Nitro Records|Nitro]] | Producer = Michael Rosen and AFI | Last album = ''[[Answer That and Stay Fashionable]]''<br />(1995) | This album = '''''Very Proud of Ya'''''<br />(1996) | Next album = ''[[Shut Your Mouth and Open Your Eyes]]''<br />(1997) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|2|5}}<ref>{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r263144|pure_url=yes}}|title=Very Proud of Ya - AFI|publisher=[[Allmusic]]}}</ref> |rev2 = [[Punknews.org]] |rev2score = {{Rating|4.5|5}}<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.punknews.org/review/633|title=AFI - Very Proud of Ya|publisher=[[Punknews.org]]}}</ref> }} '''''Very Proud of Ya''''' is the second studio album by American [[rock music|rock]] band [[AFI (band)|AFI]]. It was released on June 18, 1996 through [[Nitro Records]]. ==Background== The liner notes of the album state that all the tracks are copyrighted to Anthems For Insubordinates, the band's name at the time. It is the last album to feature bassist [[Geoff Kresge]], who illustrated the album cover as well. The album features future band member [[Jade Puget]] performing back-up vocals. The tracks "Two of a Kind" and "Yürf Rendenmein" were re-recorded from their debut album ''[[Answer That and Stay Fashionable]]''. The title of "Love is a Many Splendored Thing" is a reference to [[Love is a Many-Splendored Thing (song)|the song of the same name]] by [[Sammy Fain]] and [[Paul Francis Webster]], although it is not a cover. A music video directed by Darren Doane and Ken Daurio was made for the track "He Who Laughs Last". ==Track Listing== {{Track listing |title1 = He Who Laughs Last... |note1 = With hidden pregap intro "No-Dave Party" |length1 = 1:50 |title2 = File 13 |length2 = 1:48 |title3 = Wake-Up Call |length3 = 1:42 |title4 = Cult Status |length4 = 1:57 |title5 = Perfect Fit |length5 = 1:58 |title6 = Advances In Modern Technology |length6 = 1:40 |title7 = Theory of Revolution |length7 = 1:32 |title8 = This Secret Ninja |length8 = 2:20 |title9 = Soap-Box Derby |length9 = 2:25 |title10 = Aspirin Free |length10 = 2:45 |title11 = Fishbowl |length11 = 1:51 |title12 = Charles Atlas |length12 = 2:22 |title13 = Crop Tub |length13 = 1:50 |title14 = Consult My Lover |length14 = 1:35 |title15 = Take the Test |length15 = 1:46 |title16 = Two of a Kind |note16 = Re-recorded |length16 = 1:35 |title17 = Shatty Fatmas |length17 = 1:46 |title18 = Yürf Rendenmein |note18 = Re-recorded |length18 = 2:12 |title19 = Cruise Control |length19 = 1:11 |title20 = Modern Epic |length20 = 1:47 }} {{Track listing |collapsed = yes |headline = Vinyl edition |title21 = Who Said You Could Touch Me? |length21 = 1:24 |title22 = Rolling Balls |length22 = 2:22 |title23 = Love Is A Many-Splendored Thing |length23 = 1:33 }} On iTunes, two songs were misspelled. "Fishbowl" was misspelled "Fishbool" and "Modern Epic" was mistakenly "Modern Epidemic" but those were later corrected. ==Personnel== *Producer: Michael Rosen, AFI *Engineer: Michael Rosen *Recorded At: TML Studios, Hayward, CA *Mastered At: Future Disc By Eddie Shreyer *Guest Guitarist on "No Dave Party": Paul Marchand *Cover Drawing: [[Geoff Kresge]] *Design: Winni Wintermeyer at 3:00 AM *Photography: Tom Audisio, Dayton Paiva, and BJ Papas ==References== {{reflist}} {{A Fire Inside}} [[Category:AFI (band) albums]] [[Category:1996 albums]]
